decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish off opponents. Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon can disrupt opponents' mana bases, making it difficult for them to respond effectively. The deck aims to close out games quickly before opponents can stabilize or gain control of the board. The goal is to constantly attack and burn opponents out, making it a fast-paced and high-pressure deck that punishes any slow starts from the opponent.

This deck revolves around using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander to fuel a control strategy. The deck includes a wide range of removal spells, counterspells, and versatile cards to control the game and outvalue opponents. With a diverse mana base and card selection, the deck aims to consistently hit multiple colors to take advantage of Niv-Mizzet's ability to draw multiple cards, gaining card advantage and board control. By utilizing powerful cards like Demonic Tutor, Force of Will, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck can manipulate the game in its favor and overwhelm opponents with a mix of efficient threats and disruption.

The deck revolves around controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures, while also utilizing Faeries for additional card advantage and tempo plays. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot by disrupting their game plan, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Brazen Borrower and True-Name Nemesis. It has a strong mana base to support its multicolor spells and utilizes powerful utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire for protection and Parallax Wave for additional removal. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining a balance between aggression and disruption to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The concept of this deck revolves around utilizing aggressive strategies with Aragorn, King of Gondor as the commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures, burn spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines to apply pressure on the opponent and control the tempo of the game. With a focus on early aggression and disruption, the deck aims to establish board presence quickly and protect it while maintaining card advantage and controlling the opponent's plays. By utilizing a variety of versatile spells and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and close out the game swiftly, making it a formidable opponent in one-on-one matches.

The main focus of this deck is to combo off with Prossh, Skyraider of Kher by generating a large number of tokens and sacrificing them for value. The deck includes various ramp creatures and spells to quickly get Prossh onto the battlefield, as well as cards like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Goblin Bombardment to deal damage when sacrificing creatures. There are also disruption cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of token generation, sacrifice effects, and direct damage to win the game in a quick and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing enchantments and a strong Enchantress package to control the board and gain card advantage. Sythis, Harvest's Hand enables card draw whenever you cast an enchantment, allowing you to dig deeper into your deck and find the cards you need to control the game. The deck includes various enchantments that can hinder your opponent's strategy, such as Curse of Silence and Journey to Nowhere, as well as ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Fertile Ground to help you accelerate your mana production. By having a solid mix of control elements and card draw engines, this deck aims to outvalue your opponent and maintain control of the game until victory is secured.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful equipment to quickly deal damage to the opponent in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The commanders Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder and Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful work together to support this strategy. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Isamaru, Hound of Konda and Kari Zev, Skyship Raider, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares, and equipment like Embercleave and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance the creatures' effectiveness in combat. The inclusion of powerful lands like Arid Mesa and Mana Confluence helps to ensure the deck's mana base is efficient and consistent, allowing for aggressive plays throughout the game.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while also efficiently managing and manipulating the game state. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options to control the flow of the game. The main goal is to maintain a solid defense using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, while also building card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mystic Confluence. The deck also includes versatile options like Shark Typhoon and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide additional flexibility and value. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements for a strategic advantage.

This deck revolves around utilizing Raffine, Scheming Seer's abilities to control the board and disrupt opponents while maintaining a steady aggro strategy. It includes a mix of creature removal, counterspells, and card advantage engines to keep the pressure on the opponent while protecting Raffine. The deck also focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, and Raffine's Tower, allowing the player to maintain a full hand and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently controlling the battlefield and keeping up the pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through a combination of card advantage and strategic plays.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the commander, Marath, Will of the Wild, as a powerful aggro component. The deck includes a mix of ramp, removal, and creatures that can be used to consistently apply pressure on the opponent and control the board state. By using Marath's ability to remove counters to deal damage or create tokens, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Birthing Pod, Eladamri's Call, and Survival of the Fittest also allows for versatility in finding key creatures to further advance the aggro strategy. Overall, the goal is to build a strong board presence and finish off the opponent swiftly in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The deck includes powerful aggressive creatures like Falkenrath Aristocrat, Goblin Guide, and Zurgo Bellstriker, supported by cards like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Chain Lightning to deal direct damage. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Goblin Bombardment and Bloodghast provide additional sources of damage. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game as quickly as possible before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Slimefoot and Squee to create a fast-paced aggro strategy. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures, efficient removal spells, and powerful mana acceleration to apply early pressure on the opponent. Cards like Goblin Bombardment and Carrion Feeder can generate incremental value from sacrificing creatures, while Squee provides a resilient source of card advantage. The deck also incorporates disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's gameplan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature aggression, efficient removal, and resilient card advantage engines to secure a quick victory in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize The Gitrog Monster's ability to draw cards whenever a land is put into the graveyard from the battlefield. By combining land recursion effects like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds with sacrifice outlets and card draw spells, the deck aims to set up a loop where it can draw through its entire deck and generate a large amount of mana. This mana can then be used to cast powerful spells like Emrakul, the Promised End or Primeval Titan to close out the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's resources and protect its combo.

This Aggro deck focuses on aggressively playing creatures and dealing direct damage to the opponent. It utilizes commanders Tana, the Bloodsower, and Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful to generate tokens and maintain board presence. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, and Gideon Blackblade, along with removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Skullclamp helps to boost the power of the creatures on the battlefield. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and equipment, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently in a Duel Commander format.

The key concept of this deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence using Emmara, Soul of the Accord as the commander. The deck focuses on utilizing efficient mana dorks like Birds of Paradise, Llanowar Elves, and Avacyn's Pilgrim to ramp into powerful threats and disruptive creatures. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Hokori, Dust Drinker are included to slow down opponents and disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. Overall, the goal is to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the game with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.
